lead_paragraph: The track coach Remi Korchemny agreed yesterday to permanently stay out of elite-level coaching, marking the first time a United States Anti-Doping Agency case has led to a coach being banished for doping violations. The case is significant because it shows that the doping agency will pursue coaches, in addition to athletes.The doping agency brought charges against Korchemny, 74, last November. He is best known as the coach for the sprinters Kelli White and Dwain Chambers, both of whom tested positive for banned substances and were suspended.Korchemny, who was sentenced to probation in the Bay Area Laboratory Co-operative case for supplying the banned stimulant modafinil, was essentially retired before agreeing that he will not participate with any organization that recognizes the World Anti-Doping Code.
